Reviews.Title: “Best on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Betty S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days in October 2011 and had a wonderful, relaxing stay. Clean, quiet, great complementary continental breakfasts, and sits right on Venice Beach (the quiet end) and an amazing value. Many of the other guests were from all over the world. The hotel is walking distance to everything, yet quiet enough at night to get a good night sleep. The owner Greg was so helpful with suggestions and recommendations for things to do and places to eat, parking issues, and the computer and TV. Greg and his staff were the best! You will not be disappointed if you stay here. It's a beautiful hotel and a dreamy location. Be sure to eat your breakfast on the patio or the rooftop terrace. Thanks Greg for a wonderful Venice Beach holiday!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel L
Reviews.Content: If you want to avoid the hustle and bustle of city life, marvel at the wonderful beach, watch the sights and explore Santa Monica and beyond, then this is the place. Mine host Greg, is just superb at making life easy, especially for the travelling tourist and nothing was too much trouble. This boutique hotel is easily one of the better ones we have stayed in and would highly recommend to any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Oceanfront Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeeZ0o
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only 17 rooms. The one we stayed in was small (Room #1) but very comfy and clean with big flat screen TV. A continental breakfast is included, which you can eat on the nice rooftop with beatiful view on the ocean. Staff was nice and helpful. Parking is also included but careful though: there is only 8 spots... so like us, you might end up looking for parking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: barbiegood
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night here before flying out from LAX for Christmas holiday. The place is perfectly located by the beach and a short walk from everything going on in Venice. The room we had was tiny, but as it was one night, we didn't care. The breakfast is really great, free bagels and fruit. Also you can eat it on the roof terrace while staring at the waves. There is a free computer with internet and printer, so we could easily check in before flying. All in all I wish to be back soon for a little longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: b888
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Venice On The Beach after getting off the plane in LA and having a harrowing drive (right side of the road!?) from the airport. Seeing us stagger in and our evident sleep depravation, the manager very kindly said he would have our rooms made up early (4 hours ahead of the agreed 2pm check in) so we could rest. We parked the car in the back alley (the hotel has a few allocated parks but there is also on street parking) and took a walk down to the beach (ie. about 15m across the road) while we waited. Venice On The Beach is in a very laid back stretch of the promenade. Far enough away from the noise and chaos of the main drag to be peaceful, yet close enough to walk to anywhere of interest. The rooms are small but very clean and the beds are VERY comfortable. There is no air-conditioning, but you can open the windows for the sea breeze and there is a ceiling fan and heater. There are 2 courtyard areas so that you can enjoy the privacy of the hotel outside your room. One is a great spot on the roof, the other is a fantastic long courtyard looking across the promenade to the water. I highly recommend walking up the the convenience store, grabbing a 6 pack of Sierra Nervada and some beer nuts and sitting in the courtyard to watch the sunset (and the people go past!). This behaviour is encouraged!! Also, breakfast of bagels, cereal, filter coffee, juice and fruit is provided DIY style in the corridor. BONUS!

Reviews.Title: “bellissimo, but with a few tiny flaws”
Reviews.Author: mathildaproost
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic location situated directly on the beach and bike trail that goes north to Will Rogers State Park, all the way south to Torrance. Bike rental spots all along trail. Exactly what I was looking for. Greg (Mr. Manager!) was always extremely helpful with maps and advice. The room was quite tiny; however adequate for one person. No closet but a rack with hangers, so you could park those suitcases underneath the bed. As a short person (5"2) my feet touched the footposts, so anyone taller might be cramped in that bed. Please note that you will get a restful sleep with the tempurpedic mattresses. Very handy microwave and refrigerator in the room, as well as free computer and printer available in the hallway next to breakfast nook. Yummy fresh fruit, bagels, coffee, tea, and cereals were actually available all day, a godsend for those late-nite munchies! The only real downside was all that mold around the jacuzzi. Somewhat unpleasant, but overall did not detract from this wonderful hotel. And yes, I will recommend this property to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Plein de charme dans un cadre magnifique”
Reviews.Author: Eric35400
Reviews.Content: A extremely nice and quite location and a tremendous view over the ocean : but just select room with ocean view otherwise likely disappointing ! The building is quite old and really charming. Some heavy refurbishing is under going which will improve the global comfort : heating was very poor although efficient, room #9 bathroom was downgraded by some water, ... Decoration is really adequate to atmosphere and rooms are en-lighted by the sun and ocean view. Breakfast / coffee and snacks are ready all day along and you can get it at any time you want : it is simple but really delightful to get it on the terrace ! Welcome is warmful and well organised.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like my own beach house”
Reviews.Author: AussieLu
Reviews.Content: After a couple of weeks in wonderful but crazy Mexico, a couple of nights at Venice on the Beach was just what I needed. I had an ocean view room and loved being able to open my window at night and listen to the waves crashing on the beach. I usually don't like LA but then I've never stayed at this hotel before. I really loved it. It was in such a quiet neighbourhood and it was very nice to be able to walk along the beach. I particularly loved how close it was to some really great restaurants. I loved the Terrace - where I had baked scallops and mussels in wine and garlic. Delicious. The cool white decor was also peaceful and relaxing. I should add that Greg, the owner/manager was also very welcoming and gave out really comprehensive information to make sure my stay was as pleasurable as possible. The young woman on reception was also terrific. I really loved my short stay at Venice on the Beach, and will definitely stay there next time I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny hotel, good location, great manager”
Reviews.Author: buraksan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November 2011. Unfortunately we had only one night so didn't have much time to do much at the beach but the hotel has a very good location on the Venice Beach, just a couple of steps to the sandy beach, many bars around, restaurants etc. The manager, Greg, was very hospitable. He gave us a suite room, very spacious with a kitchenette and living room, great for families. He explained us everything, what's around, how to open the coded gate to get into the hotel late at night, and so on. There is a small parking space in front of the hotel where we parked our car. There is a PC and free internet at the hotel, and a small breakfast corner. Overall we're very satisfied with this hotel and its manager.

Reviews.Title: “Quite close to living like a local”
Reviews.Author: PDounias
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Venice on the beach with a friend in November 2011 and I lived it. The location is just unbelievable. No sign of cars and the only thing between us and the beach was a walking path running along the beach, a stone throw away from the canals and some really cool little restaurants. It dud feel like we were part of the community and not tourists. For me this is the best asset of this tiny little hotel. On the down, rooms are on the small size but functional and with personality. The owner is a great chap willing to help in ant possible way and made us feel welcome and relaxed. A small tip for the area: every Tuesday night there is live music at the Brig on Abbot Kinney blvd. The band we saw was a fantastic contemporary blues gang that improvised everything they played. The crowd was also cool and very friendly and talkative to non locals.

Reviews.Title: “Well short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: Meerkatis
Reviews.Content: Usually the Tripadvisor's average rating is spot on and reflects the reality, especially if the number of reviews runs well into 2 digits. This is the reason why we chose to stay 3 nights at Venice On The Beach though there was one warning that I was apprehensive of before we arrived (and which I will take more seriously into account going forward): despite a very high average rating, this hotel presented a significant "tail" risk, i.e. there was a disproportionately large number of reviewers that were downright pi5sed off after visiting the hotel. But knowing that Americans can often be very or even unfairly critical, I gave the benefit of the doubt and booked the hotel. With a hindsight, we would have definitely avoided staying at the hotel and would have spent a fraction more if needed to stay somewhere else in the area. I'm not giving 1 star, but 2 only because it is obvious that the owner(s) have invested some money in the place. But as a recent negative reviewer pointed out, it is questionable if all that money has been spent on the right things: very good mattresses (a positive), huge LCD TV (some trouble in getting it work, too) in a very small room - was it really needed?; good and noise-reducing carpeting in the corridors and stairs and nice roof terrace and courtyard. Unfortunately, most of it seems money spent too early as here are the major troubles we encountered while staying in room 7 (which someone had specifically suggested to avoid by all means in an earlier review): (a) both the doors to the corridor and bathroom had gaps of an inch from the bottom of the door to the floor, a consequence of which was very bright light coming into the room from the corridor overnight: (b) the bathroom was a joke: apart from the shower cabin, sink, toilet and a mirror facing the toilet rather than the sink there was nothing else, i.e. no hangers for towels, no shelfs/racks to put one's toiletries on, no hair dryer - I can see from photos that other rooms looked better in this sense, so why all rooms are not consistent?; (c) no noise reduction materials/methods used in constructing the rooms: the floors and walls are very thin; we could hear everyone talking in the corridor, the top floor was loudly squeaking,TV and even snoring easily heard from the room above; (d) the room is apparently cleaned up only on request, so issues of cleanliness arise - in fact, one night there was a hot argument between a customer and the manager that the room wasn't cleaned properly upon the check-in; (e) the fact is that Venice as such is very shady in places and someone had remarked in an earlier review on the safety issues, i.e. that there was no-one supervising in the hotel during the night though the area does attract strange folk after the sun-set; unfortunately, we had to experience this darker side of Venice as the trunk of our (rental) car was nastily scratched one night while parked in the hotel's off-street parking lot - it could have only been a hooligan, nothing else... a CCTV/other deterrent might have been a better investment than huge LCDs? All in all, I would definitely agree with yet another reviewer to look for somewhere else if you are looking for some actual hotel services. The hotel is not expensive, but still expensive for what it does (or doesn't) offer. It is most definitely not a boutique hotel. The manager himself seemed to be a nice bloke, but I again have to agree that being right on the beach is not sufficient for offering good value - I would have paid more for staying a block or two off the coast in a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab views cramped room”
Reviews.Author: Honeybun51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in June before returning to the UK. The location is a 'challenge' for your satnav but I always research prior to arrival to ensure I know where and how to park the car. It was down a back street and parking was tight for our 4x4 but it was adequate and free which is rare for this area from our past experience. Manager was out on our arrival but a note with instructions to call a mobile number from front desk was left so we could contact him to get instructions on how to get our room key. Our ground floor ocean view room was rather small and as I don't travel light our luggage was dotted next to the bed as it didn't all fit in the cupboard. The bed was comfortable but I kept hitting my legs on the wooden base which stuck out. Bathroom was tiny and window did not shut completely which on ground level was a bit of a concern. We had to leave early for our flight home and never saw the manager or the final invoice he promised but never delivered. The views were lovely and we relaxed on the sofas outside but on balance I don't think we would return as I need a little more space.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: maureenManchester
Reviews.Content: Booked well in advance and explained on the request form that we would be arriving from Auckland at 8.am and would it be possible to check in early. On arrival the hotel was locked ,we waited till a member of staff arrived and sneaked in behind her. we waited but noone acknowledged us. After about 15mins I knocked on the managers door. When we explained we wanted to check in he laughed and said not till 3. We told him we had requested early check in he said "thats only a request form" not verification, When we suggested he could have emailed us to let us know he started repeating like a mantra" Its policy at this hotel 3oclock check in" He just kept repeating this talking over us. Eventuallyafter much unpleasentness he said he could gat our room ready for 1 and would give us a room to rest in till then. This was after much discussion, we agreed and went for a walk to discuss the issue. I told my husband that the man had been so unpleasant and as it was a small hotel I would not be comfortable staying there. we went back and told the manager, he insisted on taking some payment but frankly by that time I felt really threatened and just wanted to get away What is the point of a request form if he chooses just to ignore it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aussiesmithfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lovely boutique hotel facing the pacific. We had a lovely ground floor room with views onto the beach, a small bathroom (only 2 people so it is fine) but a lovely good shower. Acomfortable room and bed with wi-fi, flat screen tv and bar fridge. The facilities are vey nice and the hotel is very clean. Greg was very helpful and gave us a thorough run-throuh of the hotel. Breakfast was continental with fruit,cereal, bagels,juice coffee/tea. The rooftop area is great for views and relaxing (fog included!). it is a lovely place to stay away from the busy L.A and not far from anything. A walk to the canals is across the road and lovely. Car parking is available and shops and resaurants are around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: AussieKC03
Reviews.Content: Sleep Quality: One King bed that was very comfortable with good pillows. Room was quiet and dark. Bathroom: Very tiny, with quite bad mould in the shower cubicle. Food: Serve yourself to muffins, fruit, cereal, juice, hot beverages. Location: Pure beach front – absolutely perfect. Our room was at the back of the hotel, overlooking the beach. 5 mins walk to restaurants and the tourist shops along Venice Beach. Service: friendly staff on reception. Value for money: Room was £100 per night including b/fast. Whilst it did represent great value and the location is brilliant, the tiny and mouldy bathroom really detracted from my stay. Other: More like a B&B. Cute small room on absolute beach front with kitchenette, fridge, dresser and free in room wi-fi. Small amount of parking available at the hotel. If cleanliness is your priority, this won’t be the place for you. Definitely worth considering if you want to wake up and look out across Venice Beach and can overlook a less than average bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and friendly place !!!”
Reviews.Author: SteenTina
Reviews.Content: Sorry for this late review , but better late than never :0) We are a couple from Denmark who stayed at this lovely hotel in january 2011. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we felt very welcome - the manager Greg is very nice, helpful and friendly, although he didn´t dare to go in the sea swimming with us :0) The hotel is right on the beach and has a nice roof top that ovelooks the beach. The rooms was small but nice (we had seaview) , but the bed could be bigger or maybe a room with twin beds. It is in the quiet end of venice beach and you can walk to the lively part of venice beach in 10 minutes and around the corner 5 minutes away there are some good restaurants :0) We would like to return another time :0)

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: Pee-ah
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on Venice on the Beach and knew to expect a modest hotel right on Venice beach. What I didn’t anticipate was too treated as not just a customer but as a guest... and a valued one at that. I arrived earlier than my scheduled check in and Greg and his friend David were more than willing to accommodate me and check me into my room early. I was shown a lovely ocean view room on the south west corner of the building that had the most amazing view of the pier. The bathroom though on the smaller side was more than adequate for my needs and the room was cosy with a Queen Bed, desk, dresser and 40 inch TV (though I didn’t watch it) and also offered was free wifi. After getting my bearings I went in search of lunch. The Terrace was recommended to me and it did not disappoint. After lunch I walked along the pier. Then went to shop for my evening meal as the room also had a fridge and a microwave. Watching the ocean from the roof top deck was wonderful as you could people watch to your hearts content. Early to bed as I wanted to explore the beaches in the morning! Had a wonderful night sleep and woke up refreshed and ready to walk. And walk I did. About 4 hours as there is so much to see and do both on Venice Beach and Santa Monica (and let’s not forget about the pier). Came back to the hotel and so wanted to soak my feet, as I looked up there was the best pedicure staring at me... the Pacific Ocean. And this did the trick. Early the next morning I needed to be at Union Station to catch my train and Greg was kind enough to have ordered a cab for me. Prior to my getting the cab there was already coffee brewing with fruit and bagels to start the day. Would I return... in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: sigmay55
Reviews.Content: super friendly and helpful staff. very beautiful room tight on the beach , nice rooftop garden to to anjoy the sun and some coffee with choccolates . wifi available and fast. thank you so much for the great time

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kozengaf
Reviews.Content: It is a good tiny hotel. We had three rooms - two on the second floor and one on the first. Second floor rooms were very comfortable with enough space if you have two bags. The first floor room was much smaller, but it had ocean view!!!))) One more thing about this room is that the shower is IN the bedroom, the only thing that separates bed from the shower are transparent doors. I guess it is not a problem for a couple, but just in case))) Another thing - in the morning the beach area becomes crowdy and lowdy, so if you plan to sleep til 12 p.m. you should ask for a non sea-view room. As it appears - roms are only cleaned if you ask. For that reason in the room you can find a special plate that you should put on the door. There is no hairdryer in the room, but it is also not a problem - you can ask for one at the lobby and keep it till your checkout. The owner of the hotel is very kind and willing to help. On the second floor there is a snack bar where you can find coffee, tea, friuts, bagels and some soft cheese))) almost perfect breakfast and you can enjoy it in front of the hotel where they have a very nice area with nice couches and tables. By the way this area has the ocean view. Hotel has its own parking lot, but not a big one, so you will possibly have to park somewhere nearby. Nearby you can find enough places to eat. The beach is beautiful, but the water is cold. And for fans - not far from the hotel you can find the Muscle beach - where young Schwarzenegger used to pump iron))) So, in general, this is a good hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: pnb_laing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a delayed honeymoon. It's a nice spot on the beach, and at a very reasonable value. The bed we stayed in was really loud, and the bathroom was small, but again, the beach was right outside the window. My only complaint was that, we chose this spot partially because of the positive reviews about the owner. When we finally arrived, after spending 9 hours between airports and airplanes, and being taken on a wild goose chase by a confused cabbie, it was late, probably 2am. When the owner answered the door he was clearly pissed at being woken up and refused to talk to us or respond to my questions. I was so angry at being treated that way I could hardly sleep. The next day he apologized for being a "sleep nazi" and the rest of the trip went quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable rooms, great location, fun friendly manager, couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: CDSB
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel. It is a brillant location for seeing the sights of L.A. and seeing the colourful local life of venice beach which we loved. The room was clean, comfortable with a fridge and microwave and very large T.V. breakfast was self service with bagels, fruit and cereal. tea and coffee and was available throughout the day! There is a computer and printer available which was invaluable as we printed of directions to anywhere we wanted to go and for purchasing tickets etc. There are also sweet bowls dotted in convenient areas. There is a great outdoor landing where you can eat your breakfast and view the ocean. Greg the manager gives an entertaining local insight into the area and is very helpful and to top it off even looks a little like Kevin Costner. We highly recommend the hotel and will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: annefw
Reviews.Content: I feel like all the previous positive reviews have this place pinned perfectly. It has a FANTASTIC location right on the beach and right in the middle of the action of Venice without being too close to the CRAZY! The property is clean and well cared for. It reminds me a bit of a bed and breakfast. The hallways are small and the rooms are too. BUT the trade off of location, location, location is well worth the sacrifice. Who needs a giant room on vacation anyway! We stayed here in the middle of our vacation. We had just stayed in a suite in Vegas and in the Disneyland Resort and we felt just as comfortable here as we did in both of those places. The owner (Greg) was VERY helpful and pleasant to chat with. The cleaning crew he has does a wonderful job and I witnessed the owner praising their work on more than one occasion. Greg takes great pride in his property and his work. And it shows. As for the parking, sure, we parked in the lot and on the street. We had NO problem finding parking when the lot was full. We were in and out at every hour of the day and night and we never once had an issue with the parking. Just follow the rules Greg tells you and you will be fine. I felt like I was "taking a chance" staying here, as I would usually be drawn to a larger chain hotel. I am so glad I took that chance and I will definetly be back again! Thanks for a great stay, Greg. It was a pleasure to meet you and I hope we see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “I will come back. It felt safe.”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller5555
Reviews.Content: Venice Beach has some very shady people. You need to keep an eye on your valuables. But this hotel has its own courtyard, surrounded by a glass fence. So you can relax and see the beach, without having to mix with shady people. I had a fantastic sleep here. It's only 20 minutes from LAX. It cost me about $22 in a taxi. Great valuable! The owner is very helpful. He gives good directions and is welcoming. The breakfast is very good. We got real fruit!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: kierrah30
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel so welcome by the owner's. The apartment was great very spacious and in the best location. we loved every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend to anyone wanting to stay on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: aegeland01
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoy checking out Venice beach when we go out to California. Last year we stayed at a hotel that was ten minutes away. We thought that was nice until we discovered Venice on the Beach Hotel! This place is amazing. If you're looking for a hotel with a great location, then this is it. It reminded us of a bed and breakfast more than a hotel but that didn't bother us one bit, in fact, we really enjoy the B&B feel to it; very comforting and accommodating. This place is literally on the beach. It has a private patio in front as well as a private roof top for sunbathing or just watching the passing by. It's just far enough from the weirdness and shops, yet close enough to walk a few minutes to get there. Just a two minute walk from restaurants and bars. We highly recommend you to stay here if you want a relaxing stay on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever. NOT ENOUGH PARKING!”
Reviews.Author: Eric8199
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Venice on the Beach Hotel in Venice Beach, and I must say that this was arguably the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I believe that Trip Advisor rates this hotel at two stars, and I think that’s over-generous. But since I’m fair, let’s start with the good. The hotel is located right on Venice Beach, very near the pier and within close walking distance to all the sidewalk shops. It’s a great location. The bed, despite looking like the frame has been around since the 1920s, was extremely comfortable, even though it squeaked with every single little movement, to the point that you could hardly breathe without waking yourself up. That’s about where the good ends. I’ve noticed that no one on here has complained about parking. Well, there are, I believe, 8-10 parking spaces at the hotel, which apparently are not enough spaces to accommodate all of the guests. My wife and I arrived at about 12:30 for our stay. Checkin wasn’t until 3, but we figured we would see if we could get in early, as hotels generally are able to accommodate this. We went into the “hotel,” that is after we found it (we drove by the first time, because it looks like a regular apartment building), and no one was at the counter. We looked down the halls, checked upstairs, and it seemed there was no one in the entire building. There was a number on the counter to call, so we called it and got an answering machine. I stated that we were at the hotel and were going to walk around, and we were hoping we could check in. We then left and walked out on the pier. We decided to then go grab our stuff and walk down the beach. When we came back to the hotel, there was a maid in the hallway. I asked her if she could check us in, and she graciously did so. She said maybe two words to us the entire time she did this. She gave us a parking pass, not saying a word about it. The room was dinky, with no carpeting, just tile. The bathroom is very small and disconnected from the teeny, tiny shower. As I already stated, the bed was very old looking, and had holes in the sheets, comforter, pillow cases, etc. It also creaked with every move. There was a nice wide screen TV with DirecTV, but the picture was fuzzy, and the universal remote worked when it wanted to. Despite this, we were happy with the location, and figured we’d tough it out for the night. Later in the evening, we returned from dinner to find all the parking spaces full. I was confused, because we had a parking pass, so I figured there must be another place around the corner or something where we could park. My wife went in and spoke to the manager, who happened to be there this time, and asked where we were supposed to park. He came out with a map and told us that if we “exercised some patience,” we could find a spot on one of the other streets either a block or two away. We were very nice to this point, but I was extremely annoyed that my $140 a night did not include a parking space, and I was not told this until about 8 p.m. that night. We drove around for I believe two hours trying to find a spot, meanwhile missing the sunset that we both wanted to see. We then went back to the hotel and I went in to speak to the manager. He was no where to be found. I again went upstairs and checked all the hallways. I knocked on the “manager” door, where it sounded like there was a TV going, and no one answered. I went to my car, still not parked, very upset, and again called the hotel. He answered, and I said I was talking to someone earlier about parking and he tells me “I’m the only one you’ll ever talk to here.” At this point, I see him at the front door of the hotel, so I hang up and go talk to him. I told him he needs to give me some better advice for parking because we cannot find a space. He again tells me that we need to “exercise patience.” I told him that I no longer wanted to stay at his hotel, and would like at least a partial refund so I could find another place to stay. He said “that’s your choice” but informed me that he had “been holding the room for a while,” therefore I was getting nothing back. At this point I was irate. We drove around for another half hour and finally found a spot approximately one mile away from the hotel. We then had to walk back to the hotel through dark alleys when I had just read Venice Beach may not be the safest after dark. When we arrived back at the hotel, we were greeted with a snide remark from him. When I left the next morning, I told him that I thought they (at this point I was again reminded that he is the only person there that I would speak to, there is no “they”) should tell people that parking is limited. I said the parking pass implied that we had a space, and that isn’t the case. He shrugged me off and informed me that $140 a night is a great rate for a beachside hotel and apparently felt that was good enough reason for his poor service. The information I was given stated that the staff would do anything to make your stay enjoyable. They did nothing for me, except treat me badly. I did not expect a refund, I mostly expected an apology and the admittance that they should have informed me there were more parking passes than spaces. In addition, there was no air conditioning in the room. During the evening, we needed to have the windows open to keep cool. At around 4 or 5 a.m., trucks began driving up and down the street, waking us up every five minutes. In addition, you could hear water running from other rooms all night, and any time someone walked overhead, the entire building creaked. I saw a photo on here someone posted of their great view of the beach. Our room overlooked the alley/road behind the hotel, though I believe my room was the last available when I reserved it, so again, it wasn’t a big deal. The roof patio is nice, though there are no chairs or tables, only uncomfortable benches. It’s kind of a waste of space, as it’s useless without chairs, though if you fly in, you probably won’t have any with you. We will not return to this hotel, and I suggest that if you plan to park a car there, or get any sort of actual service, you do not either. It would be more worth it to spend twice as much than deal with this joke of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: alpenbewohner
Reviews.Content: I found this a very nice hotel in an absolutely great location. My room was on the ground floor. It was reasonably sized with a large bed, and with an extra toilet and shower room. It’s simple but clean and comfortable, and the bed is great. There is a front terrace towards the beach, and a roof terrace both for communal use. Breakfast is simple but good and available from the buffet around the clock. The hotel is located right at the beach in a beautiful residential area, just a few minutes walk to the sport facilities and all the craze Venice is known for. Some restaurants and late night shops are a short walk away. This place was an excellent choice, and if possible I don’t think I would stay anywhere else when in the area. Free WiFi is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the beach”
Reviews.Author: JanCanberra
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant 3 day stay and enjoyed the location and proximity to restaurants and it was a short walk to bus no.1 to Santa Monica with a stop near the visitors centre. We had the use of computer and printer also appreciated the free wi-fi. Tea, coffee and chocolate were available at all times along with fruit and rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: terryhbk
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here May 1 2011. This was the best day of our 2 week vacation in California. I was beyond impressed with our room (Bigger than any appartment I have ever seen). We had sliding glass doors to a huge patio. It was extremely clean and did I mention it was right on the beach. The location could not have been better. A short walk to the boardwalk but nice because the hotel itself was so quite & peaceful. There was even coffee & breakfast in the morning. The manager Greg is so friendly and helpful. I WILL definately be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: LakerTrojanHeads
Reviews.Content: Words cant describe what a "true find" this place really is.. We stayed in the oceanview room #9. It was so nice! Be sure to open all the windows so you get the full experience. Sleeping on a temperpedic mattress ( best sleep ever & currently soliciting the hubby for one also ) was an experience in itself. The staff is genuinely nice and cares about their guests. The mgr. was even nice enough to let us park in his lot eventhough we had already checked out so we could continue with out bike ride. As we speak, I'm booking another trip back. The hubby and I have already planned to make this our Anniversary spot every year. Our stay was truely special! A diamond in the rough.....

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good value”
Reviews.Author: Mas_The_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for about a week, the room was nice and big and the manager was very helpful. It’s a small, self run place on the beach. Locationwise its was good, but the Venice broadwalk isn’t what it was 4/5 years ago. Looks like the gentrification of Santa Monica has lead quite a few of the drifters to head down to Venice, took a walk a few time up the beach never had any problems but preferred to be in the quieter end of Venice where the Hotel is. You really can't go wrong for that kind of money for a beach hotel in LA.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, like a vacation house I never had ...”
Reviews.Author: masamomo
Reviews.Content: the manager/owner is very nice and so are all other guests! The hotel is backing to the beach street and only 5 min away to everything. I will definately go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Service! Location! Quaint little hotel/Inn with cozy rooms and Greg is the warmest manager anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: leevin
Reviews.Content: Greg greeted us at the door on arrival, hauled our luggage and gave us the tour and local tips. The hotel is on the boardwalk of Venice beach in a quiet residential strip near Venice pier. We loved it so much we booked in for 2 more nights at the end of our stay. The rooms are cozy, modest but really comfortable. Greg and the location seal the deal with this property! A steal at its pricepoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great place on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Wuntyme
Reviews.Content: Venice on the beach hotel is a great hotel for your first stay in LA. The staff is very helpful and friendly especially the manager. The hotel is in a great location close to all the action but not amongst it which was perfect. All in all I cannot fault this hotel but just to be picky the parking can be busy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in a great beach front location with great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 wonderful nights at this small but really good hotel. Perfectly located at the quiet end of Venice beach right on the sea front but close enough to walk to the bustle of the tourist part of Venice Beach and walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops and grocery store. Hotel is basic but has everything you need and the free continental breakfast is a nice little extra touch, basic but starts off your day well. The room was slightly small but this is only a minor downside to this hotel. It was very comfortable and the tempur bed in ocean view room 10 was excellent. I'd highly recommend this room and this hotel. Finally Greg the owner/manager of the hotel brings a brilliant level of service to ensure you get the most of your stay. He seemed genuinely keen to want to help out, recommend places to see and print off maps. He even used his own credit card and went out of his way to help us get Lakers tickets from the Internet for a game that evening. I recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a small and basic hotel that is great value and is in a brilliant location to tour LA and offers exceptional service. I'll definitely stay here if we are visiting LA again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEM48
Reviews.Content: Just had 2 days at this terrific place. Really comfortable room in a great location. Our host Greg was friendly and helpful. Why stay in a soulless big place when you get a hotel as good as this and close to everything you need. Very highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful low-cost accomodation on the beach”
Reviews.Author: mikel3153
Reviews.Content: Although the weather was rainy, we thoroughly enjoyed our overnight stay at this well-kept, boutique-style hotel on the beach between Venice beach and Marina Del Ray. It is within walking distance of Venice beach but somewhat away from the craziness of that boardwalk area. An easy cab-ride fromLAX, it is an ideal overnight stay between flights, especially if you can arrive mid-afternoon and leave later in the morning or afternoon the next day. That lets you have time to wander the boardwalk and also visit some of the great nearby restaurants and bars towards Marina Del Ray. The staff were all very helpful and had great ideas of things to do and places to eat during our stay. The rooms as small, but clean, and in nicer weather the roof-top and front lounge areas would be wonderful to sit at and enjoy the beach and the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jsbachop1
Reviews.Content: Loved the time spent on this beach house. It had wonderful staff and was located centrally to everything on the beach. It was a short drive to Santa Monica and was great to relax. Owner takes a lot of pride in his property and delivers excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable and sweet hotel which you will fall madly in love with”
Reviews.Author: dragonflywhispers
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights during the last leg of our LA trip...and it was the perfect way to spend our last nights in America before the long flight back to Australia. The hotel is right on the beach...and our hotel room had fabulous views of the beach, pier and water. I've included some pics :) I loved the French Country style decor...decent TV...comfy bed...and the rooftop where you can people watch or enjoy the amazing sunsets. The location is in the quiet end of Venice Beach...away from the hustle and bustle of the market-style shops. I must recommend hiring a bike which you can ride along the bike paths to Santa Monica. Daughter and I had alot of fun doing that. The manager Greg is the Star of the hotel...and goes out of his way to make your stay an enjoyable one. I am sure you will have a very pleasant stay...and will also fall in love with this charming hotel like we did.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay on Venice Beach, LA”
Reviews.Author: klemsrob
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this small hotel. Location wise, I don't think you can find a better one. It's right on the beach and even better, it's in the quiet part of Venice and you don't hear any noise at all except the sound of the Ocean. The manager Greg was extremely helpful. He was always there so it was easy to get information. Parking was not a problem either. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will be going back”
Reviews.Author: christoffersenjg
Reviews.Content: Traveling from my quaint mountain home to Los Angeles was not something I was looking forward to, but this hotel makes me want to do it again. The location was perfect. A wide variety of restaurants were an easy walk away and when the tourist in me took over and I wanted to see Santa Monica pier, I rented a bike and leisurly peddled to the pier. My room faced the ocean and I slept sound every night with the sounds of the surf crashing. I meant to ask the proprietor, Greg, the brand of bed in my room because I haven't slept that well since boot camp. Greg was extremely helpful and made the stay at this fabulous hotel that much better. I want to recommend this property to everyone I meet but I don't want it to become to popular for fear of it losing some of its charm. One challege was parking. The first three nights there, I managed to get one of the hotel-owned spots but had to park on the street the last two nights. I got a tickets both nights on the street, sorry Venice Parking Authority, I don't think you're going to get the $130 out of me, and narrowly avoided getting towed the second night. I don't blame this on the hotel though. Parking is limited in Venice and I hope it stays this way. This is the perfect place to spend the day strolling and people watching. Great propery, great location and great people. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “BEST. HOTEL. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: JasminTaylor
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel. It honestly felt like a second home. When I think of bliss, I think of sitting on the rooftop of V on the B having a little drinkie and watching the sunset.. The view is to die for, the location is unbeatable and the staff of the hotel are the clincher. The girls who clean the rooms are gorgeous and will go out of their way to help you with something - like a hairdryer ;) - and the manager, Greg, is brilliant. You can tell he really loves his hotel and will do whatever he can to make you love it too. Oh, and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. If you don't have fun at this hotel, or in Venice Beach, then you're probably just a little bit boring. Greg, you rock. See you in May when I come back to LA!!

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved this place”
Reviews.Author: JeniaZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in this hotel with my husband in the late September and we are 100% staisfied with everything about this hotel. Incredible value for money! The location with just perfect for us. Very nice and special area near by Marina Del Ray, This place has a unique charm that we didn't see in any other place in LA area - it is very relaxing, layed back spot, you forget that it's a part of a big-city district . Some good restaurants (Mercedes! yammi!) are in a walking distance from the hotel. Beach is just couple steps away, nice view on the pier. I believe this hotel have the best position in the whole Los Angeles area. Venice Beach is in a walking distance, but the craziness of this place doesn't affect area near the hotel. Santa Monica is also a nice place near by. And we didn't have any problems with reaching other key areas in LA by car. Free parking, coffee/tea station, microwave, satelite TV, patio & roof terrace were a very pleasant supplement to the whole experience. Free Internet was very fast. I also like that room service was done by request. I'm not crazy about room been cleaned every day. So I think this is very smart solution, because it's done when it is really needed. General Manager Greg is a great person, very helpful. Thanks for all the tips and advises!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bizramone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a few weeks ago. After a long drive we were welcomed by the manager he was very chatty and friendly. The hotel is quite small with approx 8 rooms? Our room was at the back of the hotel and was very nice and adequate, the furnishings were all white wood with a large flatscreen TV on the wall, microwave and fridge. The bathroom was quite small but had a good walk in shower. We had a view of the beach from our bathroom only! it has a pretty roof garden and tables and chairs in the front to watch the sunset. we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, the neighbour hood was nice and quiet with bars and restaurants nearby. Round the corner we booked surf lessons and hired rollerblades. As other reviewers have said the only real downside is the parking we stayed for 4 nights midweek and 2 of those we had to find parking on nearby roads, which was no real problem we just felt a little uneasy. Also we had to ask for fresh towels as only 3 were provided for 4 days. Other than that, this is a really beautiful little place to stay that we won't easily forget.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, lovely time and would higly recomend this hotel,”
Reviews.Author: claire190747
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister spent a weekend at venice on the beach and found it to be a lovely little hotel. The location is fantastic, you can step out onto the beach. the room was a fine size for us for a weekend, with a great tv, use of internet and little coffee bar. The view was amazing. The manager was very friendly and helpful. we found this to be a really special gem of a place and were glad to have stayed there. Its a perfect place to stay to enjoy venice beach and a little walk up to santa monica beach and pier. I would love to go back and spend some more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice. Beware room 7! Checked out after I night.”
Reviews.Author: supereview
Reviews.Content: Small, tacky, very poor facilities. Delux Standard room a joke description. Dont go there, if you want a continental breakfast, a good nights sleep and a good time. Beware of the Managers sales pitch, he tries to make up for the bad room and service by making you his friend. All in all the worst place I stayed out of 15 hotels in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful manager”
Reviews.Author: yogspiers
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel right on the beach, it is also only about 5 miles from LAX, so the location really is excellent, especially for your first night or two in LA. We arrived about 10pm on a Sunday and Greg the manager was there to greet us and point us in the right direction for some food and drinks on Washington Bvd. The Terrace was particularly good for a drink at the bar and we met the guy who was behind the mask in one of the Friday the 13th films! The hotel was quiet and clean and we went to sleep listening to the sound of the ocean. There are pastries for breakfast and a nice terrace overlooking the ocean to eat them on. Greg was very helpful about where to go and how to get there and printed us maps and called us cabs. A great place to stay if you want to be near the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Horizontk
Reviews.Content: We absolutly loved the hotel. It's right on the boardwalk so no problem getting into the surf. Parking is available and the room was clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated the coffee machine which we used early (at 4 o'clock) in the morning as we still had jetlag. Your in walking distance of a few great places to go to too.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fabriane
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend mommy-getaway where I decided to stay here, alone, due to it's close proximity to everything, especially the beach. I loved it and will be back. PROS: -Location, location, location (right on the beach, steps away from Washington Blvd which has great food, bars, bike rentals, 10-min. walk to muscle beach area, and best of all it's in the safe and quiet residential end of Venice Beach...only sounds of the ocean waves at night) -Loved the wrap around patio and roof deck -Though no phone or clock in room, it had a nice big screen TV, refrigerator, microwave and desk -Greg, the manager, was very helpful. He even helped me troubleshoot my computer when it wasn't accessing the Wi-Fi. I thought it was a problem with the hotel, but he figured it out and it was my computer and he was very gracious about it. He struck me as a personable man with an honest work ethic. -Computer available for guests -Continental breakfast (nothing great, but better than nothing) -Nice hot shower with great water pressure -I thought price was on target based on my extensive hotel search in the area -Parking available, first come first served, but Greg will tell you other close by areas to find parking in a pinch. -Extremely comfortable beds and pillows! A rare find in hotels below 4 stars. CONS -No A/C, though this was fine for me because the weather was in the 70's and perfect. The ceiling fan worked great when needed (rarely) and I noticed a space heater in the closet for colder weather -First floor gets a little noisy at 8am (it's an older building so not much you can do about that). Bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper and want to sleep late. -Trash collector came crashing through town at 6:30a (Mondays are trash days, apparently). Expect a rude awakening those days. -Rooms are small, but nicely decorated and clean. All in all, it was worth the money and the location made up for any shortcomings. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “I got scammed by the manager”
Reviews.Author: Jori_V
Reviews.Content: It's been a while when I stayed there. I was watching my old photos today and decided to write this review. I was on around the world trip during Nov-Dec 2009 and stayed two nights in this hotel. Location is very good if you want to spend most of your time in Venice beach, it's right on Front walk of beach. Public transport links to elsewhere are not very good. I wouldn't call this a hotel, more like hostel or bed n' breakfast place without breakfast ;) Rooms are very simple and small so price/quality ratio is bad, only good thing in this "hotel" is it's location near beach. If you do not need anything else than a place to stay for few nights (in Venice Beach) this might be for you Serious words of warning, do not trust the manager Mr. Greg Ralston !!! My first impressions about him were that he is nice and helpful guy that is obviously not true at all. He charged full payment of my booking in day the of my arrival (30th Nov) from my credit card account without asking me !!! I asked him next day how do we proceed with payment as I was leaving hotel very early in the morning (they do not have 24h reception). He said not to worry about it he will let me know later on. That was the last time I saw the guy. He didn't call me or sent SMS or email or leave any note in my room so I left the payment as cash (+ left I $60 as tip which was stupid as I didn't really get any service there) in my room with a hand written note and I called him in the office hours next day and asked if everything is fine with that. He didn't tell me on the phone he charged the room with my credit card as well, I noticed that afterwards from my credit card bill. I requested twice to get refund as I paid the room twice, but never get any reply back to my emails !!! About his helpfulness: I asked if he could arrange me drive from Universal studios to Honda Center (Anaheim, Orange County) during the time I was on guided L.A tour. We said he will take a look at it and will let me know... well he didn't of course. And I asked if he could arrange me a taxi to LAX airport at 0530am next morning, surprise surprise he didn't, so I walked to cafe nearby (half a mile) with my heavy bags and was happy to see they were just opened, and they helped me by calling a cab, otherwise I might have missed my flight to Las Vegas !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NewWanderer76
Reviews.Content: This is a very small hotel so if you are entertaining grand visions of big establishments or lot of services, this isn't for you. Its a nice little place, which is well maintained, with a very warm feeling about it. Location? is RIGHT on the Venice beach!! I mean literally the front yard opens on the beach. It is a small place, but feels very homely. Greg (I hope the name is correct) was very helpful and accommodating, he even suggested things to do in LA, including printing out a Google map and charting out the suggested driving route to the attractions. We had some mis-communication regarding our arrival but all got sorted out just fine. We had a beach facing bedroom which was nice. The free breakfast (modest fare but nobody's bragging about it either) was sufficient for whatever its worth. Parking though free is extremely limited (i think 4-6 spots) but you get free parking in the street parallel to the Speedway (that's the street where this hotel is, ocean drive is actually not accessible for automobiles). The hotel is located in a really nice area, you can checkout all the Venice beach attractions within a 2 min walk from here. There's a boardwalk right in the front of the hotel as well as 3-4 beach volleyball courts. All the reviews were correct about the place, glad I stayed here...

Reviews.Title: “Cute little rooms right on the beach...”
Reviews.Author: HMeade
Reviews.Content: Cute little rooms right on the beach, rooftop garden to sunbake and enjoy the complimentary coffee, danishes, chocolates and wifi on. And the staff are super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Informal, good value, comfortable hotel in a great setting”
Reviews.Author: Scott018
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. The management is relaxed and friendly. Comfortable, clean room. The hotel is right on a fantastic beach. Has a patio and informal roof terrace overlooking the beach. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at a great location with staff that went above and beyond the call of duty!”
Reviews.Author: Sbrewer2
Reviews.Content: Fresh off the plane we arrived at Venice on the Beach hotel. Our first view was looking through the hotel to the ocean. Simply amazing is how we felt. Then we were greeted by Greg, the owner and manager runs the hotel, and he takes his customer service to the highest level. First, this was a crazy sort of weekend adventure me and a couple of friends devised. We flew into LA at 9am LA time. Greg accommodated us by holding our luggage, both at arrival and when we checked out he held it till we left at 9pm for the red eye. This alone was probably enough to make me feel spoiled by hotel staff. Upon arrival Greg was full of local tourist information. He told us where to get surfing lessons, which were great, where to get a bite to eat, where we could find additional parking if necessary, how long it would take to get to anywhere. The hotel itself is right on the beach and the only local hotel as far as we could tell that is on the beach. The hotel is nestled in the Venice beach neighborhood. Right out the front door is the Venice beach boardwalk. The hotel doesn't offer some fancier amenities, such as room service or a restaurant in the hotel, but it was perfect for us. Each room was adequately equipped and nicely decorated. The rooms all had a microwave and a fridge. Rooms were simple, but homey. I gave sleep quality a four because there was some neighborhood noise in the morning. This was just part of the location experience though. I'd recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place....”
Reviews.Author: cycloi
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights at this hotel and we loved it. Quiet little hotel (about 20 rooms only) just a few feet away from the beach , on the quiet side of Venice Beach, just by the Venice Pier. Quiet side but however just a few minutes away from the promenade and the all the fun. Staff is very helpful, smiling, make you feel like home. Rooms are simple but cute, very confortable bed, great flat tv screen with cable, free internet (free computer on 1st floor if you don't have a laptop). Free coffee or tea all day, and a great sundeck roof. Definitly a great place to go to enjoy this lovely part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EdwardCanada
Reviews.Content: This Hotel exceded my expectations. Although the room was small it was clean and had all we needed. Greg is a great manager and will try hard to meet all your requests. It is in a perfect location and your receive good value for your money. Parking is free but with only nine spaces it could be a problem. To remedy this I would suggest when it is full your park at the Municiple lot 10 across from the Marriot at 4100 Admiralty way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, beachfront location! Small, quiet and clean and close to everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Debndenver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at VOTBH for the first time in mid March 2010. My visit truly exceeded my expectations. Greg who runs this small, newly renovated hotel was a pleasure to deal with. The rooms are small, but emaculate with many new appointments. I slept with the window open, enjoying the sounds and breezes off the ocean and the sea gulls. The hotel has free parking (in contrast to Hotel Erwin down the Boardwalk which charges $30/day). There is free internet, coffee and snacks in the common area and a lovely patio right on the Venice Boardwalk as well as 3rd floor rooftop deck. I did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, but it was so nice to come home at night to a clean, beautiful and quiet room at the end of a busy day of sightseeing! Definitely will recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Blue1956
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at VOTBH..it wa smy birthday and it was 4 days of rest, and relaxation. As always the room was clean and comfortable with an ocean view. It rained a little but not enough to hamper our activities. We flew in from San Jose. We did not rent a car..was not into any other sightseeing. Once at the beach, we did not want to go elsewhere. We took several walks and relaxed reading and watching the olympics and movies on HBO and showtime. We had a great dinner at C&O Trattoria, a freindly casual Italian restaurant. Coffee at the Cow's end is a must. They also have excellent breakfast bagel sandwiches for $5..and othe muffins etc. They also have sandwiches, salads. We walked along the canals, oceans and side streets. Took one wlak to the crazier end of the Venice Beach where you can see all types of people. Beautifaul sunsets, sounds of waves and conversations of people passing by. Long hot showers and a friendly movtivated Host aka Greg! He greets all the guests with a welcoming and informational conversation. This is a low key and comfortable lodging, nothing fancy but the location is the best! There are a few shops to do some t shirt shopping, wine and food buying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: RFarina
Reviews.Content: Manager is only available, according to his phone message, from 8am to 6pm. So outside these hours -- you're on your own. When we got there 8 pm on our check-in day, front door was locked and no one answered. We had to call and wait 20 minutes for anyone to let us in. I was willing to forget this, but on our last night parking lot was full, and no one around to suggest an alternative. Despite repeated calls, no answer or suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Rates”
Reviews.Author: seangus
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this place enough. Must be the best location in Venice. Right on the boardwalk. Steps to the Venice Pier. Rooms are clean and simple with big screens. Rates are great. Greg is friendly, delightful and helpful. He made the stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: beanmitchell
Reviews.Content: For a sightseeing vacation of L.A. area, you can't miss with this hotel. It's right on the beach and just around the corner from several great restaurants and bars. It doesn't offer much in way of services or extras but when your purpose is to enjoy the sights, it's not likely you'll be spending much time in the room anyway. There was coffee, juice and sweets for breakfast as well as internet access. The rooms were average in size, comfortable with flat screen TV and kitchen with small fridge. There's only a few parking spots behind the hotel but we were fortunate not having any difficulty getting one. We were told, however, that there was free parking available a few blocks away. We selected the cheaper rooms to the back. The only noises we heard were the garbage and delivery trucks. Of course, the hotel can't be held responsible for this. There's also a patio right along the main walking path or on the roof to sit and have drinks while watching people go by or just looking out over the beach. I loved Venice Beach and will definitely go back! Riding a tandem bike along the beach was great fun! It's also not far from Santa Monica pier to take in the amusement park or do some shopping on 3rd Street Promenade in Santa Monica.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a beach getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Tripleseven777
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Venice on the Beach Hotel and really enjoyed it. AMAZING location GREAT service CUTE oceanview room TRUELY a good value for the price I would and will go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, great value, location, parking”
Reviews.Author: Pickles
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Venice on the Beach. Very few hotels in this part of LA offer such a nice combination of value and location. While not a luxury hotel, Venice on the Beach has free parking, great views and a congenial host. The rooms are clean and simple although very fussy people might be bothered by the fact that a previous guest's suitcase wheels had left some marks on one wall. The hotel is just south of the active part of Venice Beach, so we enjoyed both the peace and quiet of a residential area with a short walk to the more lively section. Our only problem was that we were so tired when we arrived that we forgot to read the note from Greg and did not clue into the fact that guests need to put a "Clean this room, please" sign on their doors when they want maid service. We wondered why the trash hadn't been emptied until we checked out and I read the note.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view but not boutique....”
Reviews.Author: aurora_mae
Reviews.Content: Obviously, I don't need to inform anyone of this VOTB's obviously spectacular location. It is literally a stone's throw from the beach....amazing. However, it is certainly nothing of the boutique hotel it claims so enthusiastically to be. With it's sparsely scattered breakfast (packaged pastries - eugh - and bitter coffee with powdered milks....) on a narrow table next to the ageing computer facility, it doesn't even really qualify as a B&B. We popped down to the cafe on the main corner of Venice for a coffee and a bagel. At only a few dollars each, it was worth the small commute along the sand! The room we had was pleasant enough... Fully equipped with a microwave, fridge, iron and large plasma t.v. Bed was reasonably though not extraordinarily comfortable and when I wanted a few pillows, I couldn't find the manager (for an entire day....) to ask. Some people have mentioned the lack of sound insulation. We found waking at 5 a.m. to the sound of quacking ducks on the street bemusing, but that was probably our jet-lag. Less bemusing was the sound of people, nattering in the hallways or the next room. It gave off a distinctly hostel-ish feel. The roof terrace could have been amazing. The view certainly was. But the faded, bristly, astro-turf floor and total lack of charm was odd. It felt more like a roof-top putting green. Greg the manager was rarely to be found, and we felt brushed aside and something of a problem even when attempting to make pleasantries. So bad was it that we had planned to stay again the next week, but checked out silently the next day and booked somewhere else. Stay for the view, not the boutique treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: beqbeq
Reviews.Content: Venice on the Beach is a wonderful hotel situated in a perfect area. We loved our stay in Los Angeles so much and a lot has to do with the wonderfulness that was the Venice on the Beach Hotel and its manager Greg. Greg was so helpful, always ready to answer any of our questions and was just a really friendly guy - he made us feel so welcome. Venice on the Beach is literally located on the beach which is awesome and is situated in the nice area of Venice. When we booked it we were a little sceptical in that by staying in Venice we thought we may not be in the "heart of it all", however once we travelled to the where all the "action" is, Hollywood etc we were SO glad that we had chosen Venice as our area to call home. It was nice to be able to drive into the crazyness and awesomeness that is Hollywood and Beverley Hills etc but it was so refreshing knowing that we could go back to peace and quiet each night in Venice. We travelled all over LA including, Beverley Hills, Hollywood, Santa Monica, Anaheim, Laguna Beach, Redondo Beach, Newport, Malibu, Calabasas etc and loved every moment of our holiday and we also suggest that you hire a car if you want to visit as much as you can in LA! Would recommend Venice on the Beach Hotel to anyone and everyone, it is perfect!! Will stay here again :). Also our rooms were perfect. Perfectly maintained, elegant and cosy. The beds were the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on also!!!!! Free Wi-Fi is also a bonus oh and the free car-parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: funkysoul
Reviews.Content: Greg the manager left us 2 very nice notes as we arrived way too late, nevertheless the hotel is located directly at venice beach, we were unlucky to arrive late and leave very early in the morning, if you go there, be sure to take an ocean view room and enjoy the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Angry”
Reviews.Author: ed30
Reviews.Content: Had booked throughExpedia to stay one night at the Hotel. When we got there we were asked if Expedia had got in touch with us as we we re being moved to a sister hotel. We had not been contacted. The other hotel when we got there was in a less desirable area of the beach, didn't feel safe, and there was no parking. We were told it would either be street parking or pay $20 for a patrolled car park. We cancelled our stay and found another Hotel. We felt that the Venice on the Beach has regular visitors and the we had been moved to accomodate them. Very angry at this as this part of the beach looked really good to stay at and it ruined Our first real night of the holiday. We have asked for a refund through expedia and wouldn't recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! Already planning a second visit...”
Reviews.Author: xxiheartmtlxx
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotel's I've ever stayed in. It was our third time to L.A, however our first time on Venice Beach...and it was FABULOUS. Firstly, the manager, Greg, is extremely accommodating. He's constantly available for you [he even gives you his cell phone number so he can be reached at all times], and gave us a tour of the property the minute we got there. I work in the Travel Industry, and let me tell you...he's the definition of Hospitality. The hotel cannot get any cuter. With a total of only 17 rooms, the hotel is very welcoming, charming and home-y. The rooms aren't fancy, but they are just what you need...a bed, t.v, and a washroom. The location is more than perfect...it's faces the ocean, right on the beach, which enables for a fantastic Pacific breeze at night time [keep in mind there is no air conditioning at this property, but it's not necessary...the ocean takes care of that]. Right by the hotel is Washington Blvd, where you'll find a number of restaurants, bars and shops. Be sure to try the garlic rolls at 'C & O Trattoria' right on Washington Blvd...to die for! Another great feature: the hotel is within walking distance from Venice Beach's famous boardwalk, however still far enough to not be bothered by the constant activity from the boardwalk. I plan to go back very soon. I wouldn't stay anywhere else on Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Venice Beach area”
Reviews.Author: Quilters_Loft
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based mainly on reviews we had read. Our stay was for two nights and, in our view, it did not quite live up to its very high rating. It does have an unbeatable location and Greg, the manager, was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are plain and rather non-descript but adequately clean and comfortable. The room was not made up for us between our first and second nights, which didn't really matter to us, but which one might expect of a hotel rated as this one is. We were on the main floor and noticed that screens on several of the windows were either missing or damaged. If we left our windows open, as we wanted to do both for fresh air and to hear the sound of the waves breaking on the beach, we had a bit of a feeling of uneasiness that there was nothing to secure the louvered blinds or sliding windows from being opened from the outside. That said, there was never an issue. The pastries left for guest use did not seem to get rotated and we found one near the bottom of the pile that was mouldy, probably as it had been there for some time. We also found the walls to be rather thin as we could hear guests in adjoining rooms and the hallway very clearly. We very much liked the patio out front and alongside the hotel. It was a great place to sit and relax, read and people watch. The rooftop deck was a bit of a disappointment. It had only some stark wood benches and it appeared not to have been cleaned in some time. There was an overflowing ashtray, empty beer bottle and other bits of debris that appeared to have been there for a while. With a good cleaning and a few lounge chairs, this would have been another great place to spend some time. As noted, the hotel is ideally located...right on the beach, at the quiet end of the VB strip and a few mintues walk to several very nice restaurants. If you are visiting Venice Beach (and it is worth a visit), we have no hesitation in recommending this hotel but you should understand that you will not get the equivalent of one of the big chain hotels...nor will you get the attitude they sometimes give off. The VB is unpretentious and laid back. With just a bit more effort and attention to small details, it could be top rate.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and attentive owner..............just lacks the finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: Mancy_boy
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my partner for a few days and overall did enjoy it As mentioned it is right on venice beach and only a couple of minutes walk from the pier but there are a few things that this hotel could improve on to help make your stay that little bit more comfortable. The positives are that the owner was a really friendly guy and always had time for his guests, there was a pc upstairs with free internet access which is really handy to pop on and use and considering i wasn't expecting it there was a continental breakfast, (never ate anything but was handy to have a coffee or orange juice first thing in the morning). The few downsides were at the night time there were only limited spaces outside the hotel so if you wasn't there early on you would have to find alternate parking which could be a real pain. The room we were in had a plug next to the bed where all the plaster had come away and was barely hanging in to the wall, the mattress was so creaky that it could wake you up from the noise if you moved on your side in the night and it was often quite noisy in the mornings with doors banging, people walking down the stairs etc. The roof terrace was fantastic but just wasn't fully utilised (couple of sun loungers up there would have been brilliant). With a few improvements this hotel could be fantastic, it just isn't quite there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: westiebigfoot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Venice on the beach hotel for 2 nights in September as the final stop on our West coast holiday. A bit of a shock when we arrived and drove down the back street to the hotel, as it seemed a rough area but soon got over the shock once we have arrived at the hotel and found our feet. Hotel is right on the beach so you can hear the ocean as you go to sleep. Room was clean and adequate for our needs for 2 nights. Greg the manager is really nice and keen to ensure your stay is as comfortable as possible. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Place to sleep minutes from the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Sant
Reviews.Content: As the name implies, the hotel is on the beach. Once you step out the door, you are on the boardwalk, approx. couple minutes walk from the pier. The shops on the boardwalk are about 10-15 minutes walk. For a small hotel, the manager was very professional and helpful. For a very clean, spartan room, I was surprised by the wall-handing LCD hooked to a satellite receiver and the medium-sized refridgerator. Most fridges I find in rooms are typically filled with expensive snacks and beverages. This one was empty (except for lack of defrosting) and meant solely for the guest. Unfortunately, the hotel is on the beach. That said, there is only enough parking for 9 cars. If you return to the hotel when all the lots are full, you will need to look for street parking which is easier said than done depending on time of day. Because of a nearby property a few feet away, I was able to clearly hear the occupants entering and leaving the premises from my ground-floor room. The wall outlet in the room was hanging by its wire and was inoperable. I had to use the one in the bathroom which was situated between the sink and the toilet. Fortunately, I did not have to recharge my shaver; otherwise, there was nowhere to rest it. In the mornings, I had some coffee which was brewed using household coffeemaker, but passed on the pre-packaged danish pastries. I am recommending this hotel due to its location as long as you don't require more than a place to sleep, If you have a rental and plan to return late in the evening, I strongly suggest getting a cab and leave the car on the hotel premises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kraemstein
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Sep 2008. Great Place! Great Location! Great People! I would definitely stay here the next time we are in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Casi26
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! I fell in love immediately! I was traveling on my own and needed a couple of days away from the hustle and bustle before heading back home so i booked a room here. You couldn't find a better location. It has a real homely feeling. The owner Greg is friendly and laid back which makes a real difference. I look forward to staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Live in Venice, have stayed here & so will all my guests!”
Reviews.Author: hmaltby
Reviews.Content: I live a few blocks from this hotel. When my hot water heater burst on a Sunday morning, my boyfriend and I decided we need to stay somewhere overnight so that we could shower before work Monday. We spent most of Sunday looking at every hotel, and rooms inside the hotel in Venice and Marina del Rey from the Holiday Inn express all the way to the Ritz-Carlton. We were not that thrilled with any of the choices and out of the blue I remembered this hotel and called to see if we could see a room. We were very happy with the comfort of the room, it was more like an actual bedroom than a cold hotel room. We walked a few feet for dinner since all of the great places to eat are within a 2 minute walk, and we enjoyed the roof top deck and the beach the next day. I have told many people about this place and feel very comfortable having every visitor stay here too. If you stay here you will not forget it.

Reviews.Title: “It would be hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: C_Lam02
Reviews.Content: This place really is right on the beach and it is definitely the better end of Venice beach. You can stumble out of the front door and be standing on sand immediately. But you wont be surrounded by freaks or crowds. There are lovely outdoor areas and plenty of places to eat close by. We can recommend The Cows Rear for great coffee. But the rooms are very small. It was hard to get around the bed without hitting your knee. On the other hand, the decor is modern and clean - clean white linen was very refreshing after crappy motel decor. I can see why parking could be a real stress if it was busy. We were very lucky and got one of the 5 free parking spots out the back of the hotel every time we needed it. Greg the manager was a bit off hand with us, but got the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Greg!”
Reviews.Author: DH95020
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a road trip to Southern California. We didn't make plans on where we were going to stay, we were going to wing it. When we arrived in Venice, we did not know where to stay, but we knew we wanted to stay on the beach. While driving down the back of the alley by the The Venice Beach Hotel, Greg, the manager, came walking out the back door and we asked where we could stay on the beach. Behold, he said "you are looking at it". He gave us a tour, and we said we'll take it! Greg was great and so is the hotel. The hotel is an excellent location to the beach (right across the sidewalk), the main strip and restaurants. Bring your walking shoes! The manager, Greg, was very accommodating, pleasant, always walking around with a smile on his face. His personality made you feel really comfortable, he was like a friend! The hotel is very clean and quaint. It even has a computer, thank goodness my work didn't know that!
