The roof top is a great place to see the view of the ocean and surrounding places, and also a great place to meet other guests. My sister and I can't wait for our next road trip. We will definitely stop at this hotel again. Thank you GREG for everything. We had a blast! Enjoy, Debbie

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Beau_and_Monique
Reviews.Content: As other posts have highlighted, the location of this property is unbeatable. The rooms are small but comfortable with bathrooms, fridge, plasma tv etc. The hotel has a coin operated washing machine and dryer for use and there is 1 computer for use. Continental breakfast entailed tea/coffee and pastries, a usual continental breakfast i.e nothing special or fancy. The owner is extremely helpful and attentive with anything you require. The roof top is basic but a great place to relax with a couple of drinks as the sun goes down. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the craziness of the Venice Beach stalls etc and a 2 minute walk to Washington Avenue. There is no supermarket within the immediate vicinity apart from a small grocery type store however I guess the aim is to eat out every night anyway. My wife and I hired some bikes for one of the days (I think they were $20'ish dollars each for a full day) and rode down to Malibu. We caught a bus from Hollywood and it was relatively easy to navigate. We then caught a bus to Union Station which was quite easy too.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeUser
Reviews.Content: As a hotel this is quite decent, but nothing to rave about -- would give it a three. But the location, WOW. Can't get more on the beach anywhere in the U.S., and it is a great beach. Very short walk to Washington Avenue which I think is one of the nicest gathering of restaurants on any beach that is close in to LA. Bit longer walk the other way to Venice Avenue, interesting slice of the American sub-culture, glad not to stay there! As to the hotel: small room, but comfortable; very clean and nice TV. Walls a bit thin, but neighbors were quiet so this didn't become a problem and the sound of the surf is a big plus. Free computer but no printer. Free parking but not many spots. Free breakfast pretty barebones (walking down to Wash. Ave was our choice). Rooftop deck not much. Beach level patio nice. Making a reservation was impossible, so we walked in and got a good rate. Would return without question given that the location is unbeatable and the hotel more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MomsEscapeOnGrlsTrip
Reviews.Content: Our girls trip wrapped up with a visit to the beach. We wanted to be near enough to LAX to not worry about traffic slowing us down when it was time to catch our mid-morning flight, but not so close we'd hear planes all the time. We'd never been to Venice Beach before, so we didn't know how weird and crazy the atmosphere is. Venice on The Beach Hotel is far enough away from that notorious section of the boardwalk that we felt very safe, even walking at night up a block and around the corner where there are shops, restaurants and bars. That said, security is in place on the exterior of the property, but not always in use (key pads on locked gates, but gates easy to open from outside or not shut). The doors to guest rooms have key pads as well, which is very handy - no key to worry about. The rooms are not large (it's a "boutique" hotel, which, it turns out, means "small"), and there are only 17 of them. We had the one room that had more than one bed, and unfortunately it did not face the beach. The street out front is more an alley, and we did hear traffic noise, but we're both pretty serious sleepers so it didn't bother us much. And you're active at the beach, so falling asleep is sure easy if you're exhausted! Parking was no problem for us, but we may have been lucky because there are not as many parking spaces as there are rooms. I almost marked "Cleanliness" a 4 instead of 5, but taking into account we were at a beach, things are not spotless - and the housekeeping staff was excellent. They were courteous and friendly. "Rooms" got a 4 just because of the size - our bathroom was pretty small with no room to put toiletries (pedestal sink, no vanity). The beds and pillows are very comfortable. There is a flagstone patio with tables and chairs on the back and side of the building (the only designated smoking area is on the side patio) and a rooftop deck that has room for improvement - but with the view, who cares about the Astroturf flooring or inadequate seating?! Greg is the proprietor, and he is fantastic. Very friendly, and it's clear that he loves what he does. He described the plans he has for the rooftop deck, and it will be the key feature of this place once it's completed. We had a great time here, and wouldn't hesitate to come back, especially if the rates stay in the same range they are now. Our rate was very reasonable for a place on the beach, and at least half the price of properties we considered in Santa Monica or Manhattan Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!!”
Reviews.Author: modesty4ever
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for 4 nights. We came from NYC and Las Vegas, and were almost swept off our feet by this place, especially the location. 22 steps to the beach! Rooms are very small (though fresh), and there was no cleaning done during our stay, but we got anything we asked for. The manager, Greg, is great, the hotel offers free computer/internetaccess and you can do laundry for 1.50 dollars. This place is a dream if you are like us: in the late 20´s, backpacking, have a budget to stick to and want to come close to the authentic surferlife in Venice! We can´t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too many compromises including ONE WHOPPER”
Reviews.Author: vrosso
Reviews.Content: The Good: -Location -Nice laid-back manager -Jacuzzi in the bathroom though we ended up not using it -Cheap -Parking The bad: -Very small room. Barely enough room to get around with 2 people in there. This is the least important negative to me and I don't actually care too much, but I wanted to let other know. -Included breakfast is a joke: packaged danishes (think little debbie's) and make your own coffee. Again, don't really care. -There are only about 6 parking spots available. If they're full, you have to go park a block or 2 away (still free). No biggie there. The ugly: -No insulation between rooms and hallways. When someone's in the hall, you know it. We got woken up every morning at 6am by other people just walking around and chatting. -No security. Venice beach is not the best neighborhood at night (though it has gotten better) so this made us a little uncomfortable. There's no one at the front desk, the main doors are locked with a code you're given, but they're windowed doors so not exactly Fort Knox. -Also the rooms are locked with combination locks (which beep quite loudly, see insulation note). Not a big deal, but Greg, the manager, is quite cavalier about giving you your code, announcing it loudly. Not sure how often the codes are rotated either. -The bathroom door is windowed, so anyone sitting on the bed can see into the whole bathroom. Not a big deal except when I'm doing my "business" where I'd rather be private. -the bathroom had a weird smell to it... I dismissed it as bleach, but it lingered -Greg, though a nice guy, is not always on site and he seems to be the only employee other than the maid. -We had to pay in full at check-in The unacceptable: Cockroaches! Yes, I found 2 cockroaches on 2 different days in the bathroom. They were small, but still cockroaches! If it weren't for this, I could probably recommend this hotel to others with a few caveats since the location and price are great. But nothing can excuse this. It made us very uncomfortable even to sleep there, but it was too much hassle to leave and we had already paid. I would have said something to Greg, but he was rarely around including when I left. I've meant to contact him to let him know about this, but I was too busy immediately after my trip, and now I'm tired.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect final destination!”
Reviews.Author: LiMa208
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days, 3 nights in the hotel with the amazing view and location. It was our last destination after a two week tour. The location is totally the opposite from LA. It's really quiet with only the sound of the ocean to completely relax. Greg is amazing, espacially with his tour of the hotel, a whole 10 minutes :-) It's definitely your money`s worth. We are going to enjoy our last day here en say goodbye to Greg in the morning and unfortunately we have to leave California and go back to Holland. Greetings Martijn & Lisa

Reviews.Title: “Truly a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: timandaliceLaVerneCA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of spending the weekend at this wonderful little...oops, the manager Greg (who was fantastic) would like it referred to as a boutique hotel, but no matter what you call it is a great hotel. The location is unbelievable, the staff is outgoing and goes way out of their way to satisfy, the rooms are well appointed and comfortable, and the patio and deck are wonderful. i hesitate writing this review only because it will probably mean more business for Greg and make it harder to visit this great little (boutique) hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GingerLB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value with a great location. My only concern was the mattress in Room 9 actually creaked when we moved. Did not make for a very good nights sleep. The rooms are small but very clean. The design is pretty blah. If they tweeked some small things, they could probably raise their rates. Rooms need a little TLC, pretty bland. Great restaurants in the neighborhood and the management is outstanding. Greg is a very nice guy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, View, Restaurants, and Much More”
Reviews.Author: coachchappo
Reviews.Content: For the second time we chose this cosey hotel to spend our spring break at and it was just as good as the first. The manager Greg makes everyone feel comfortable and goes to no end to please. The rooms are a tad smaller than some but very clean with several rooms having great views of the ocean.  Just steps away from the pier and on Ocean Walk where you can shop and take in some interesting sights. A number of great restaurants are right around the corner and if needed the manager has several other suggestions. Every year we see many regular customers at this hotel. Right now, there is no other place that we would like to say at for the price and enjoyment.  (Bill & Debbie)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: jhightower
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Venice Beach where we stayed at the Venice on the Beach Hotel! My husband and I couldnt have been any more impressed! It was a great location with much to do in the area! The staff were as friendly as can be and were very personable and helpful! We had an oceanfront view and it was amazing! Our room was very clean and cozy! We loved it so much, we are already planning our next trip back!!

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Venice On The Beach Hotel on President Day. The location was perfect. We had a side ocean view and we could hear it loud and clear all the time. The economy room was small but very cozy and CLEAN, the bed was comfortable, and the bed sheets were soft and smelled like fresh laundry. It was perfect! In the hallway there was a small station with computer (internet), coffee and danishes, which was nice in the morning. The hotel's manager was very friendly and helpful. And all that for under $90! We will definitely stay there next time we visit LA and I will recommend this hotel to anybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: mhracing
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Venice on the Beach Hotel. The location is absolutely perfect. The hotel is less than 7 miles from LAX and the beach is only steps from your room. You're within walking distance of the crazy area around Muscle Beach, and only a short bicycle ride to the Santa Monica Pier. Less than a 5 minute walk south, you're at the Washington Blvd/Venice Fishing Pier area, which offers numerous restaurants and bars. The area is very quiet & safe. This hotel is in a very nice & upscale residential area. However, I do suggest the better lit Washington Blvd area at night, versus heading north on the Ocean Walk back towards Muscle Beach. Our room was awesome with a perfect ocean view. Comfortable and clean bedding, and a 42" LCD TV on the wall. The hotel has a great patio and a cool rooftop deck, perfect for watching the sunset. There is only a handful of parking places on a first come first serve basis, but there was no need for my car to move since everything I needed was within walking or biking distance. If parking is taken, just park at the Venice Pier public parking area. Overall, I couldn't ask for a better experience at the Venice on the Beach Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jermels
Reviews.Content: Directly at the boardwalk, wunderfull and small hotel. Well away (walkingdistance) from the muscle beach hassle, quietly located. Rent a bike, drive the boardwalk and enjoy Venice, Santa Monica, beach and ocean. Clean and nice rooms (mine had a huge LCD television...). Hotelmanager maximally helpfull, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: parky2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but wow what a location could not be better, roof balcony overlooking ocean , fab walks in both directions. Very friendly and helpful manager and staff. Very clean and tidy bedrooms with extremely comfortable beds . On the negative side i would personally prefer a kettle in the bedroom rather than a microwave, having said that coffee ect was available on the landing. Our jet lag ment we needed a drink at 4.00a.m. and creeping about in a nightie was a bit spooky. The only other down er is room maid service . Although plenty of clean towels made availabe. Our room probably a one off did not have clothes hanging space but our friends traveling with us did. so maybe our room a one off. For the men folk large flat screen tele;s with six hundred channels . I would definately recommend . Linda and Richard Parkinson

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year!”
Reviews.Author: DropAnchor
Reviews.Content: We rang in the New Year at this sweet little hotel. The management is awesome and we had everything we needed - I am a real clean freak, and the bedding was spotless and comfy. It IS an older building - don't expect the Ritz! You can expect an ideal location at a very good rate with great personal service. Rooms are fairly small, but you are here to be outside looking at the ocean - not cooped up! We loved the patio with a whole ocean and boardwalk view. We love funky Venice and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy inn, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: symbiont
Reviews.Content: Look out the front door here and what do you see? The ocean, sand, palm trees, a band of grass, a long non-commercial pier off to the left, a coastline walkway where the occasional dog is being walked or a family bikes past. That's essentially it! Yes, you are in Los Angeles, but this little inn claims a precious, relaxing location that in our travels is quite unique. It's less than 2 blocks from a collection of restaurants and a small market, a quick walk up to the "muscle beach" tourist area with little food stands and t-shirt shops. The beach itself seems endless. "The Google" gives you the correct location when you search for "2819 Ocean Front Walk, Venice, CA" You can use the "street view" to see the neighborhood. Accommodations were very comfortable and clean. The host, Greg, and staff were friendly and helpful. Parking right at the back door was amazingly convenient for this area (but we were there off-season). We stayed in the suite (three of us), which was very spacious, full kitchen, our own patio area. We don't demand the fit-and-finish perfection of a Hyatt, so for a right-on-the beach small inn, this gets a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great cosy place to stay in..”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter044
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to CA this year and we chose the same hotel because it`s a great hotel for several reasons. The location right on the beach in a residential area is perfect. Also the hotel is located very near by the exclusive area "Marina del rey". Restaurants and Starbucks are very close by. We stayed in a very nice and cosy room with ocean view. All rooms we saw are small to medium size, individual, clean and comfortble with big TV screens, fridge and microwave. Every morning there is a nice smell of fresh brewed coffee and some breakfast snacks are there too. The manager Greg is a very friendly and helpful person. He will make everything possible he can. No doubt we will go back when we visit CA again.

Reviews.Title: “The only sound from our room at night was the ocean”
Reviews.Author: LSL112008
Reviews.Content: We only regret that we didn't spend more time at this simple, small hotel we made our home while we were visiting Venice Beach and Santa Monica. The charming and historical architecture of VB and SM kept us out and about and walking during the day. Frank Gehry's famous beach house is nearby, as is Washington Boulevard where at its ending by the beach there are a cluster of small convenient restaurants. Our room was lovely and well lit, and faced the ocean which in this quiet residential section of Venice Beach is close enough to hear at night. Just down the hall was a desk with a computer with free internet access for use by the guests, and a small table with coffee, tea, and in the morning, OJ. For breakfast and snacks we kept food in the 'fridge in our room. The hotel's terrace faces palm trees, the beach, and the walkway in between, and a rooftop that is perfect for watching sunsets. The manager was friendly, professional, and seemingly always available. It's not a fancy or an elegant place with a lot of frills, but in its simplicity it's absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “coulda been great, wasn't”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: A nice, comfy beachfront hotel in Venice, reasonably priced (for a beachfront property), what more could you want? While the rooms were pretty at first glance, signs of aging were obvious (chips, stains). The manager was nice, friendly, helpful, but housekeeping was iffy (room was not serviced at all during a five night stay). Noise from the common spaces escape into the rooms. The bed was big and comfy, big screen tv, fridge. Free WiFi worked well. There are restaurants (some good, some bad) about a block away as well as a Starbuck's and convenience stores. There were about 5 or 6 parking spaces at the hotel. I found parking available most of the time, and there were spaces on Pacific (a block away) when the spaces were occupied. The area is more residential than commercial so exterior noise wasn't a problem. All in all, pretty nice place to spend a few days, but for the $, expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: mimi257
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Venice on the Beach Hotel in Venice CA was wonderful. The hotel location was great, right on the boardwalk, facing the beach... and only a few blocks from the Muscle Beach area and many restaurants and shops in Venice. I personally enjoyed the comfortable feeling of this smaller hotel. I so enjoyed the laid back atmosphere.... which is what Venice Beach is all about. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. There is no doubt that we will stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beach motel”
Reviews.Author: dvespa
Reviews.Content: This is a very well-located, "refreshed" motel, not really a hotel as most frequent travelers would understand a hotel to be. It's best for travelers who like to stay in little inns, guest houses, motels, and nicer hostels and who seek out a fun adventure (rather than travelers who seek the consistency of moderate to pricey chain hotels). For what it is, Venice on the Beach is definitely a #4, which is why I ranked it as such, but I myself was surprised when I drove up to it because the reviews on TripAdvisor made it sound like it was a different kind of establishment. Instead it's very "down home" with some nice features. Just for context, I am a female business traveler who travels frequently and solo. While I usually stay in mid-range business hotel chains (Hyatt, Hilton group, Starwood group, etc.), , in my personal travel I like high-end hotels and resorts as well as artsy, cool little places off the beaten path. The really positive things about Venice on the Beach: great location right on the beach, warm and friendly staff, laid back and independent feel, good wireless, comfortable bed and pillows, soft, fresh white linens, rooms conveniently appointed, two great outdoor public areas to hang out which look directly out onto the beautiful beach where many people are jogging, walking their dogs, and enjoying the beach. Despite the action, it is relatively quiet. Less appealing things about it: The feel is definitely that of an older motel that has a fresh coat of paint (without having stripped the old paint first) and new windows and bathroom fixtures. There was some nice effort made, but the finishes and workmanship are a bit rough. As a solo female traveler, I would not have felt comfortable walking around the area at night, but I had a car. There are a few parking spaces in front of the building that are first come, first served. I didn't have trouble parking when I returned after dinner, but reportedly it is harder to find parking in the winter. I don't know what I would have done if all the parking spots were taken as street parking is very restricted around that area. My room was small but had a big window looking directly out on the beach (which I paid extra for but was worth it). The window had pretty white wood shutters. The bed was comfortable with fresh white cotton linens. The rest of the furniture (desk, nightstand) was white laminate that was peeling or stained in some areas. There was a small fridge and microwave in the room. Ceramic tile floor, small bathroom with new fixtures and a ceramic tile shower. Generally clean but because the redecorating was done roughly, the overall feeling is new finishes in a worn context. On the other hand, I fell asleep and woke up to the sound of the ocean right outside my window. Although I heard other guests when they were in public areas, my night itself was quiet and peaceful. I did not eat the continental breakfast in the morning, but there are packaged pastries, coffee, and tea set out. The staff was welcoming, accommodating, and warm. Well located for beach, restaurants, major highways, Venice, Santa Monica, and Marina del Rey. If you have a few extra hours, drive up to Malibu beaches along the coast.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: eldepp
Reviews.Content: If you are into doormen, concierges, room service, and bell hops this hotel is not for you. But if you want a home away from home, the easy going feel of a country B n B, what a gem! This little place on Ocean Front Walk, just a few steps north of Venice Pier is for people who seek a laid back beach atmosphere, but with access to the wilder side of Venice Beach just a short work further North, and to the South, the more sophisticated night life and restaurants of Marina Del Rey. The staff, a two person team, general manager and housekeeper, are warm and friendly, doing all they can to make your stay comfortable. Ladies, bring your own hair dryer!

Reviews.Title: “Geat experience, You have to go!”
Reviews.Author: Walter_Adry
Reviews.Content: I booked at Venice on the beach Hotel after reading reviews and i did the right thing! In the original plan I had to spend only 3 days but i decided to go back at then end of my planned tour in the Utah and Arizona Parks and spend the last 4 days of my holiday. The hotel is really nice, clean, with car parking and ocean front....what else do You need? Greg, the manager, is a great person, ready to help and support in any of your question. The hotel is 10 minutes walking from Muscle Beach, a few steps from restaurants, bars and bikes/rollers rentals. There is only one sad thing to say.... go back home!!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and convenient. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AlanDorsetUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently situated for all the goings-on in Venice and Marina Del Rey where our sons live. It's right opposite the beach once you've crossed the path. There are great places to eat with plenty of choice that are only a walk away. We often had great meals in the Terrace just round the corner. The rooms were very clean and Greg the manager was top notch. Free internet access was real bonus as were the many channels on the massive flat screen TV. We would not hesitate to book another stay. Greg treated us like friends from the very start of our two week stay and always had time to give we English visitors helpful advice on everything. Annette and Alan. England UK.

Reviews.Title: “Woderfully Surpirising”
Reviews.Author: PNMcVey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room mid week in July. When we arrived, we were pleasantly suprised. The hotel was intimate and right on the beach. The prices were very competitive and because the hotel was not booked to capacity, we were upgraded to and ocean view room at no extra chaged. It is a small hotel without a bar or a restaurant but it is well within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The owners are modernizing and renovating the hotel but that did not interfere with our stay. The manager was top notch without a question and I firmly believe that he is their greatest asset. I give it a 9+.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere & coziness!”
Reviews.Author: minimags
Reviews.Content: My daughter lives in Venice. While I was there we stayed in the Venice On The Beach Hotel...I figured if I were going there, I wanted to be 'on the water' and we just about were. One could not get any closer. Out the private patio (cute, clean, well furnished) and there we were! The price of $200 a night was fantastice compared to other availability. The room was very clean...although small (especially the bathroom (nice water pressure too!) it was tastefully decorated. Gotta tell you though the bed (king) & the pillows were extremely comfortable. Left the lovely shuttered windows open & nothing better to sleep by than the sound of the busting surf and breeze. The mgr. Greg, was very nice. The place felt like a little home away...very relaxing atmosphere. Would definitely recommend it. Parking is at premium but we did not have any real problems. Would I stay there again? Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the venice on the beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaBigkev
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel on the beach in the quiet part of venice beach 200 a night Greg the manager was the best rooms are not too big but my god you are on the sand the loews shutters and casa del mar are all at least 500 a night and this blows doors on those places you can walk to the marina I did hear the old manager was from hell though but loved my stay enough to write this

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityKatharine
Reviews.Content: I love visiting Venice Beach and The Venice on the Beach Hotel has become a particular favorite of mine. Cozy and adorable, it is the perfect place for short or long-term stays. Nestled right between Marina Del Rey and Santa Monica, the hotel is fresh and fun and full of interesting wayfayers who are easy to chat with in the open beachfront setting. Right outside, Ocean Front Walk beckons with easy beach access, nearby restaurants and great people watching. The hotel -- always cheery, clean and very capably managed -- never fails me. I always feel relaxed and happy when there to get my beach fix and to mix it up with all the glamour of LA.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MeganChandi
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable and spacious place to stay that was reasonably priced. If you are looking for a place to stay that is right in front of the beach this is the place to be. Luckily, this hotel had nice guests during my visit (except a guy named Nelson) and our room had a kitchen, bathroom, and a plasma TV in the living room and bedroom. There was also a washer and dryer in the hotel which was fantastic b/c I could wash my dirty clothes when I came home—and sometimes I wanted to wear something twice so I was able to wash it there. It felt like I had never left home! It was wonderful. Every afternoon the maid came in and organized our room after we left. Thus, the entire time we were able to relax without being disturbed by the maid, b/c we had put the sign on our door (good thing to remember to do when coming in the wee hours of the morning- We had left the door sign out not to disturb us while we were there, in the mornings, and put the sign out to tidy our room when we went out in the afternoon, so the room was ready when we came back.). Therefore, the maid and the manager were very helpful. So, basically my advice is: if you are not a caveman/woman and can appreciate the finer things in life and want a nice, relaxing place to go, the definitely stay here. Venice on the Beach Hotel rocks!

Reviews.Title: “A room with a great view!!!!”
Reviews.Author: urbaqua
Reviews.Content: I called in advance and was advised the hotel was under renovation but I decided to book anyway. Since the hotel was this close to the beach and the rates were outstanding compared to similar properties along Ocean Front Walk, I decided to take a chance being I would not be at the property much during the day time hours anyway. My newly renovated room had an ocean view room to die for. I receiveed excellent service from the manager Matthew and the maid Anna.I have a return reservation for the month of July. I will be staying for the whole month!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Front European Family Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelvenice
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing quaint, great location, family feeling small hotel directly on the beach near Washington Blvd with great restaurants and bars. If you are looking for a fancy 24 hour room service type place, this is not it. But if you are looking for an incredibly affordable, clean, great location good people hotel this it. The manager is very courteous and accomodating. The cleaning staff great and we had many family type BBQs on their fabulous deck. BTW, it's super quiet, especially compared to the boardwalk part of Venice and much safer as far as crime and such. Guests choose to stay here for many months at a time as it is a great place to land. I was only planning to stay a week while looking for a place to live as I relocated for a new job and gladly stayed for over a month. You meet all sorts of interesting and talented folks here. Of course there were occasional grumpy quests that had a rude sense of entitlement (I think I actually met the woman who posted a bad review here... scary)... but for the most part I got to know all the neighbors and it had a very European family run hotel feel. In the end it was hard to find a place to live as nice as this Hotel for the same price!!! Eventually I found something that suited my needs but it wasn't eeasy and that's another reason many people enjoy staying there long term. This is a great place to land, especially for a long term stay... Enjoy Michael

Reviews.Title: “lots of potential, but many issues as they revamp”
Reviews.Author: swelch
Reviews.Content: This place has a nice feel and I hope they will pull it together, but there was a lot that was frustrating about my stay here. I stayed for a weekend with a group of friends and we experienced many issues. The good: * Great location - right on Venice Beach within walking distance of the main boardwalk. * Prices are very reasonable. * Room options vary - we had a standard room, one with a queen and a single bed and a suite with a kitchen and a living room. * NIce patio overlooking the beach * flat screen tvs, microwaves and minifridges in each room * Friendly manager who did his best to accomodate us (but seemed overwhelmed). * each room is decorated differently - felt more like a homey bed and breakfast than a hotel (without the breakfast). The bad: * The hotel is still under construction - it was loud and the halls were crowded with construction equipment. * They were redoing locks while we were there - we had seven people and were only given two keys to the exterior doors of the hotel. * There is not always staff onsite - the manager made several home depot runs while we were there and was only accessible by cell phone. It took several hours to check into one of our rooms. *Very limited parking - there were ~18 rooms but only about 6 parking spots. * Cleaning services poor - the dishwahser in the suite was full of dirty dished from the previous occupant, trashcans were not emptied daily, and the bathrooms were not very clean. * Bad soundproofing in the rooms Good or bad depending on your perspective: * They accept dogs

Reviews.Title: “loved the staff and location”
Reviews.Author: cat101glasgow
Reviews.Content: we saw this hotel as we walked on the beach, we booked in and stayed for a week, we loved it clean modern, and frirendly helpful management this was the 3rd hotel we stayed in in los angeles , it was the cheapest and the best value for money,we jumped on the local buses everywhere walked or hired bikes the manager janie walsh was brilliant and even ran us to the airport when we missed the shuttle. 5****** rating for everything and i have stayed in 5* hotels .The local is great for every age group and we will stay again soon all our needs were met.

HotelInfo.Name: Venice On The Beach Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2819 Ocean Front Walk, Venice, Los Angeles, CA 90291
